Marionette.Drivers.Abstract.name: Marionette.Drivers.Abstract
Marionette.Drivers.Abstract.description:
Abstract driver that will handle
 all common tasks between implementations.
 Such as error handling, request/response queuing
 and timeouts.

Marionette.Drivers.MozTcp.name: Marionette.Drivers.MozTcp

Marionette.Drivers.Tcp.name: Marionette.Drivers.Tcp

Marionette.Actions.name: Marionette.Actions
Marionette.Actions.description:
Actions is used to denote a set of actions that
have to be executed in particular order.

Marionette.Client.name: Marionette.Client

Marionette.CommandStream.name: Marionette.CommandStream
Marionette.CommandStream.description:
Command stream accepts a socket or any event
emitter that will emit data events

Marionette.Element.name: Marionette.Element
Marionette.Element.description:
Creates an element reference
based on an id and a client instance.
You should never need to manually create
an instance of element.

Use {{#crossLink "Marionette.Client/findElement"}}{{/crossLink}} or
{{#crossLink "Marionette.Client/findElements"}}{{/crossLink}} to create
instance(s) of this class.

Marionette.MultiActions.name: Marionette.MultiActions
Marionette.MultiActions.description:
For a multifinger gesture, we can use MultiActions.
For example, one finger to hold down
while the other finger moves from one element to another.

classitems.description: Timeout for commands
classitems.name: timeout

classitems.description: Waiting for a command to finish?
classitems.name: _waiting

classitems.description: Is system ready for commands?
classitems.name: ready

classitems.description: Connection id for the server.
classitems.name: connectionId

classitems.description:
Sends remote command to server.
Each command will be queued while waiting for
any pending commands. This ensures order of
response is correct.
classitems.name: send

params.name: command
params.description: remote command to send to marionette.

classitems.name: connect

params.name: callback
params.description:
executes
  after successfully connecting to the server.

classitems.description:
Destroys connection to server

Will immediately close connection to server
closing any pending responses.
classitems.name: close

classitems.description:
Checks queue if not waiting for a response
Sends command to websocket server
classitems.name: _nextCommand

classitems.description:
Handles responses from devices.
Will only respond to the event if the connectionId
is equal to the event id and the client is ready.
classitems.name: _onDeviceResponse

classitems.description:
Horrible hack to work around
missing stuff in TCPSocket & add
node compatible api.
Sends a command to the server.
Opens TCP socket for marionette client.
Receives command from server.
Closes connection to marionette.
Sends a command to the server.
Opens TCP socket for marionette client.
Receives command from server.
Closes connection to marionette.

Send a 'touchstart' event to this element. If no coordinates are given,
it will be targeted at the center of the element.
If given, it will be targeted at the (x,y) coordinates
relative to the top-left corner of the element.
classitems.name: press

params.name: x
params.description:
optional, x-coordinate to tap,
                  relative to the top-left corner of the element.

params.name: y
params.description:
optional, y-coordinate to tap,
                  relative to the top-left corner of the element.

classitems.description:
release() can only be called
if press() has already be called on this element.
Send 'touchend' event to whenever the finger is.
classitems.name: release

classitems.description:
move() can only be called
if press() has already be called on this element.
move() send 'touchmove' event which moves the finger to target element.
classitems.name: move

classitems.description:
moveByOffset() can only be called
if press() has already be called on this element.
moveByOffset() send 'touchmove' event.
classitems.name: moveByOffset

params.name: x
params.description:
x-coordinate relative to the top-left corner of
                  the target element of the last touch.

params.name: y
params.description:
y-coordinate relative to the top-left corner of
                  the target element of the last touch.

classitems.description: wait() waits for specified time period.
classitems.name: wait

classitems.description:
cancel() can only be called
if press() has already be called on this element.
cancel() send 'touchcancel' event to whenever the finger is.
classitems.name: cancel

classitems.description:
tap() performs a quick tap on the target.
action.tap() is essentially action.press().release().
classitems.name: tap

params.name: x
params.description:
optional, x-coordinate relative to the top-left corner
                  of the element of the last touch.

params.name: y
params.description:
optional, y-coordinate relative to the top-left corner
                  of the element of the last touch.

classitems.description:
doubleTap() performs a double
{{#crossLink "Marionette.Actions/tap"}}{{/crossLink}} on the element.
classitems.name: doubleTap

params.name: x
params.description:
optional, x-coordinate relative to
the top-left corner of the element of the last touch.

params.name: y
params.description:
optional, y-coordinate relative to
the top-left corner of the element of the last touch.

classitems.description:
flick() sends a sequence of touch events:
touchstart, touchmove, touchend.
It scrolls the page in any direction
within period of time provided(duration).
classitems.name: flick

params.name: x1
params.description:
starting x-coordinates of
                   the finger relative to the element.

params.name: y1
params.description:
starting y-coordinates of
                   the finger relative to the element.

params.name: x2
params.description:
ending x-coordinates of
                   the finger relative to the element.

params.name: y2
params.description:
ending y-coordinates of
                   the finger relative to the element.

params.name: duration
params.description:
optional,
                         time needed for the flick gesture for complete.

classitems.description:
Sends 'touchstart',
then wait for 'time' seconds, and send 'touchend' eventually.
longPress() cannot follow any active touch,
i.e. the finger must leave the screen before longPress() gets called.
classitems.name: longPress

params.name: time
params.description: the waiting time between touchstart and touchend.

classitems.description:
perform() will send the whole action chain built
so far to the server side for execution.
classitems.name: perform

classitems.description: Helper to set scope and state on a given client.
Helper to get state of given client.
Constant for chrome context.
classitems.name: CHROME

classitems.description: Constant for content context.
classitems.name: CONTENT
_hooks

classitems.name: actor

classitems.description: Session id for instance.
classitems.name: session

classitems.description:
Resets the internal state of the client.

This is only safe to do when the client has no session.

classitems.name: plugin

params.name: name
params.description: to expose plugin on in the client.

classitems.name: runHook

params.description: to run once hooks are done.

for hook must take a single argument
 (see above).

classitems.description:
Sends a command to the server.
Adds additional information like actor and session
to command if not present.

params.description: to be sent over the wire.

the part of the response to pass \
                            unto the callback.

scope
waitFor

props.name: timeout
props.description: maximum wallclock time before failing test.

Finds actor and creates connection to marionette.
This is a combination of calling getMarionetteId and then newSession.
classitems.name: startSession

classitems.description: Destroys current session.

classitems.description: Callback will receive the id of the current window.
classitems.name: getWindow

params.name: callback
params.description: executed with id of current window.

classitems.description: Callback will receive an array of window ids.
classitems.name: getWindow

params.name: callback
params.description: executes with an array of ids.

classitems.description: Switches context of marionette to specific window.
classitems.name: switchToWindow

params.name: id
params.description: window id you can find these with getWindow(s).

classitems.description:
Imports a script into the marionette
context for the duration of the session.

Good for prototyping new marionette commands.

classitems.description: Switches context of marionette to specific iframe.
classitems.name: switchToFrame
setContext

classitems.description: Drives browser to a url.

params.name: callback
params.description: executes when finished driving browser to url.

classitems.description: Drives window back.

Converts an function into a string
that can be sent to marionette.

params.name: fn
params.description: function to call on the server.

classitems.description:
Processes result of command
if an {'ELEMENT': 'uuid'} combination
is returned a Marionette.Element
instance will be created and returned.

classitems.description:
Prepares arguments for script commands.
Formats Marionette.Element's sod
marionette can use them in script commands.
classitems.name: _prepareArguments

params.name: arguments
params.description: list of args for wrapped function.

classitems.description:
Executes a remote string of javascript.
the javascript string will be wrapped in a function
by marionette.
classitems.name: _executeScript

classitems.description:
name of the event this class
will emit when a response to a
command is received.

Parses command into a string to
be sent over a tcp socket to marionette.

Writes a command to the socket.

Adds a chunk (string or buffer) to the
total buffer of this instance.

Sends remote command processes the result.
Appends element id to each command.

params.name: responseKey
params.description: key in the response to pass to callback.

params.name: callback

callback function receives the result of
                           response[responseKey] as its first argument.

Taps an element at given x and y coordinates.
If no offsets are given, it will be tapped at the center of the element.

classitems.description: Clears element.

size

classitems.description:
Returns an error object given
a error object from the marionette client.
Expected input follows this format:

Codes are from:
http://code.google.com/p/selenium/wiki/JsonWireProtocol#Response_Status_Codes

   {
     message: "Something",
     stacktrace: "wentwrong@line",
     status: 17
   }

Define a list of paths
this will only be used in the browser.

Exports object is a shim
we use in the browser to
create an object that will behave much
like module.exports

Unified require between browser/node.
Path is relative to this file so you
will want to use it like this from any depth.


  var Leaf = ns.require('sub/leaf');

params.name: path
params.description: path lookup relative to this file.

classitems.description: Maps exports to a file path.

to a global namespace
obviously 'Module' would
be whatever your global namespace is.
